Correctness.description: The accuracy of the answer provided by the agent(s) involved in the task.

accepted_values.Perfect: The answer is fully accurate and meets all requirements.
accepted_values.Minor Inaccuracies: The answer contains only minor inaccuracies but still fulfills the main requirements.
accepted_values.Major Inaccuracies: The answer contains major inaccuracies, failing to satisfy key requirements.

Reasoning Traceability.description: The ability to follow the logic or reasoning chain used by the agent(s) to arrive at the solution.

accepted_values.Clear: The reasoning process is well-documented and easy to follow.
accepted_values.Unclear: The reasoning process is documented but is hard to follow or understand.
accepted_values.Not Traceable: The reasoning process is not documented, making it impossible to trace the steps taken.

Efficiency.description: The computational efficiency of the solution, including runtime and resource usage.

accepted_values.Optimal: The solution is optimized for runtime and resource usage.
accepted_values.Suboptimal: The solution has room for efficiency improvements but operates within acceptable limits.
accepted_values.Inefficient: The solution is not optimized, leading to excessive runtime or resource usage.

Robustness.description: The ability of the solution to handle different scenarios and inputs without failure.

accepted_values.High: The solution reliably handles a wide range of scenarios and inputs.
accepted_values.Moderate: The solution handles common scenarios well but may fail with edge cases or uncommon inputs.
accepted_values.Low: The solution is prone to failure and cannot reliably handle diverse scenarios and inputs.

Adherence to Requirements.description: How well the solution aligns with the specified task requirements.

accepted_values.Full: The solution meets all specified task requirements.
accepted_values.Partial: The solution meets some but not all task requirements.
accepted_values.None: The solution does not meet the task requirements.

Error Handling.description: The solution's capability to handle and recover from errors.

accepted_values.Graceful: The solution handles errors effectively and recovers smoothly.
accepted_values.Manageable: The solution recognizes errors and provides ways to manage them, though not always gracefully.
accepted_values.Poor: The solution does not adequately handle errors, often leading to crashes or failures.
